org.conqat.lib.commons.assessment.external

Class PrefixSuffixFileResolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.conqat.lib.commons.assessment.external.PrefixSuffixFileResolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFilePathResolver

    public class PrefixSuffixFileResolver
extends java.lang.Object
implements IFilePathResolver
    A file resolver that works by adding prefixes and suffixes to the base name. Optionally, it can also map paths into a parallel directory tree. This tree is determined by an "anchor directory" (such as "src") that is searched in the path to find the point of the parallel tree, and the replacement directory (e.g. "ratings") where the parallel tree resides. See the test-case for examples. Note that the fully qualified name of this class is used in the rating comments of many code files. Thus, rename or move this class only if it can not be avoided.

        public void init(java.lang.String... args)
          throws ExternalRatingTableException
        Initializes the resolver with additional arguments..
        Specified by:
        init in interface IFilePathResolver
        Parameters:
        args - the arguments taken are (in order) the prefix, the suffix, the anchor directory and the replacement directory. It is ok to provide only one or two parameters (prefix or prefix and suffix).
        Throws:
        ExternalRatingTableException

      • getRelativeFilePath

        public java.lang.String getRelativeFilePath(java.lang.String path)
        Returns the path relative to a provided file path.
        Specified by:
        getRelativeFilePath in interface IFilePathResolver
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file. The caller of this method guarantees that forward slashes are used as separator in this path.
        Returns:
        the relative path, using forward slashes.
